title: Warm Sesame-Maple Cabbage Sauté (Richer Version)
description: A savory-slightly-sweet cabbage skillet with extra richness.
ingredients: 2–4 tsp lemon juice or rice vinegar
instructions: Thinly slice the green cabbage and set aside.
Heat the olive oil and sesame oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the sliced cabbage and kosher salt. Sauté for 3–4 minutes, stirring often, until the cabbage softens and begins to brown at the edges.
Reduce heat to medium. Add maple syrup, lemon juice or rice vinegar, and black pepper.
Cook another 1–2 minutes until the seasoning coats the cabbage and it looks glossy and slightly caramelized.
Taste and adjust seasoning. Sprinkle with sesame seeds if using.
notes: The extra oil gives a softer texture and helps the maple caramelize. If the cabbage ever feels too wet, just cook 1–2 minutes longer uncovered to evaporate moisture.
